en: For I would not, brethren, have you ignorant, that our fathers were all under the cloud, and all passed through the sea;
hmr: Unauhai, hieng hi in hriet naw ka nuom nawh ie, khânga ei thlatuhai po po sûm hnuoiah an um vawng a, an rênga tuisuoriet khawm an kai vawng a;

en: and were all baptized unto Moses in the cloud and in the sea;
hmr: an rênga sûma le tuisuorieta khawm Mosie bêl dinga baptisa an um vawng a,

en: and did all eat the same spiritual food;
hmr: an rêngin thlarau tieng bu hmunkhat khawm an fâk seng a,

en: and did all drink the same spiritual drink: for they drank of a spiritual rock that followed them: and the rock was Christ.
hmr: an rêngin thlarau tieng dâwn ding hmunkhat khawm an dâwn seng kha; anni zuitu thlarau tieng lungpuia kha an dâwn seng kha; chu lungpui chu Krista a nih.

en: Howbeit with most of them God was not well pleased: for they were overthrown in the wilderness.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, anni laia mi tam lem chunga chun Pathien a lung- ni ta nawh a, thlalêra khan tluhlumin an um a.

en: Now these things were our examples, to the intent we should not lust after evil things, as they also lusted.
hmr: Chun, chuong chu eini ta dingin inentirna a nih, thil suol an châk ang bawk khan ei châk ve nawna dingin.

en: Neither be ye idolaters, as were some of them; as it is written, The people sat down to eat and drink, and rose up to play.
hmr: Anni laia mi ṭhenkhat milim betu an ni ang khan milim betu ni naw ro, “mipui chu fa le dâwn dingin an ṭhung tâwl a, infiem dingin an tho nâwk a,” ti ziek ang khan.

en: Neither let us commit fornication, as some of them committed, and fell in one day three and twenty thousand.
hmr: Anni laia mi ṭhenkhatin nu- nghâk an dit a, ni khata sîng hni le sâng thumin an tlûkhlum pha ang khan, in dit ve nâwng ei tiu.

en: Neither let us make trial of the Lord, as some of them made trial, and perished by the serpents.
hmr: Anni laia mi ṭhenkhatin Lalpa an fieh a, rûla sukbohmanga an um pha ang khan Lalpa chu fie nâwng ei tiu.

en: Neither murmur ye, as some of them murmured, and perished by the destroyer.
hmr: Anni laia ṭhenkhat an chier a, sukbohmangtu sukbohmanga an um ang khan chier naw bawk ei tiu.

en: Now these things happened unto them by way of example; and they were written for our admonition, upon whom the ends of the ages are come.
hmr: Chun, chuong chu inentirna dingin an chungah a hung tlung a ni kha; eini hun tâwp hung tlungnahai hi mi zil dingin an ziek a n i bawk a.

en: Wherefore let him that thinketh he standeth take heed lest he fall.
hmr: Chuleiin, ngîra inring chu fimkhur raw se; chuong naw chun, tlu rawi a tih.

en: There hath no temptation taken you but such as man can bear: but God is faithful, who will not suffer you to be tempted above that ye are able; but will with the temptation make also the way of escape, that ye may be able to endure it.
hmr: Mihriem ituor thei ang bâk chu thlêmna hrim hrim in chungah a tlung ngai nawh. Pathien chu a ringum a nih; ama chun in tuor thei bâk chu thlêmna in tuor phal naw ni; in tuor theina dingin thlêmna ruolin tlân suokna lampui siem nghâl lem a tih.

en: Wherefore, my beloved, flee from idolatry.
hmr: Chuleichun, ka idittakhai, mi- lim biek hi tlânsan ro.

en: I speak as to wise men; judge ye what I say.
hmr: Mi varhai kuoma hril angin ka hril a nih; ka thu hril hi ngaituo ro.

en: The cup of blessing which we bless, is it not a communion of the blood of Christ? The bread which we break, is it not a communion of the body of Christ?
hmr: Malsâwmna no mal ei isâwm hlak hi, Krista thisen inṭawmpuina a ni naw am a nih? Bei ei khawi hlak hi Krista taksa inṭawmpuina a ni naw am a nih?

en: seeing that we, who are many, are one bread, one body: for we all partake of the one bread.
hmr: Eini mi tamtak hi, bei tlang khat, taksa pumkhat ei ni hi; ei rêngin bei tlang khata inthawkin ei chang seng sih a.

en: Behold Israel after the flesh: have not they that eat the sacrifices communion with the altar?
hmr: Tisa tienga Israelhai chu en ta u; inthâwina sa fatuhai chun mâi- châm chu an inṭawmpui a ni naw am a nih?

en: What say I then? that a thing sacrificed to idols is anything, or that an idol is anything?
hmr: Ieng am a na ka hril? Milim hmaa thil inhlân chu hlutna nei thil am a nih? Milim khawm chu thil tlâktlai am a ni?

en: But I say, that the things which the Gentiles sacrifice, they sacrifice to demons, and not to God: and I would not that ye should have communion with demons.
hmr: Jentailhai inthâwina chu Pathien kuomah ni loin, khawhrihai kuomah an inthâwi hlak ti ka hril lem a nih; nangnirawi chu khawhrihai in inṭawmpui ka nuompêk naw cheu a ni hi.

en: Ye cannot drink the cup of the Lord, and the cup of demons: ye cannot partake of the table of the Lord, and of the table of demons.
hmr: Lalpa no le khawhri no dâwn kawp thei naw ti niu, Lalpa dawkâna le khawhri dawkâna chu fa kawp thei naw bawk in tih.

en: Or do we provoke the Lord to jealousy? are we stronger than he?
hmr: Annawleh, Lalpa chu thîk ding- in chawk tho ei tum a ni maw? Ama nêkin ei hrât lem am a nih?

en: All things are lawful; but not all things are expedient. All things are lawful; but not all things edify.
hmr: Thil iengkim thaw a thieng a; nisienlakhawm, thil iengkim thaw a ṭha kher nawh. Thil iengkim thaw a thieng a; nisienlakhawm, thil ieng- kim thawin a mi siem ṭha kher nawh.

en: Let no man seek his own, but each his neighbor’s good.
hmr: Tûkhawmin mâni ṭhatna ding zawng loin mi dang ṭhatna ding zawng lem raw se.

en: Whatsoever is sold in the shambles, eat, asking no question for conscience’ sake;
hmr: Sa dâwra an zawr taphawt chu sie le ṭha hrietna leia iengkhawm indawn loin fa el ro;

en: for the earth is the Lord’s, and the fulness thereof.
hmr: hnuoi le a sûnga um po po hi Lalpa ta a ni sih a.

en: If one of them that believe not biddeth you to a feast, and ye are disposed to go; whatsoever is set before you, eat, asking no question for conscience’ sake.
hmr: Awinaw laia mi tuin amanih a fiel cheu a, fe in nuom si chun, sie le ṭha hrietna leiin iengkhawm indawn chuong loin an pêkhai taphawt cheu chu fa el ro.

en: But if any man say unto you, This hath been offered in sacrifice, eat not, for his sake that showed it, and for conscience’ sake:
hmr: Amiruokchu, tûin amanih, “Hi hi inthâwina a nih,” tiin a hril cheu chun, ân hriettirtu cheu lei le, a sie le ṭha hrietna leiin fa naw ro;

en: conscience, I say, not thine own, but the other’s; for why is my liberty judged by another conscience?
hmr: nang a sie le ṭha hrietna ka ti nawh a, mi dang sie le ṭha hrietna chu ka ti lem a nih. Iengdinga mi dang sie le ṭha hrietna chun ka zalênna a sawisêl am a na?

en: If I partake with thankfulness, why am I evil spoken of for that for which I give thanks?
hmr: Lâwmtaka ka chang chun, a chunga lâwmthu ka hrilna chunga hin, iengdinga hrilsieta um am ka na?

en: Whether therefore ye eat, or drink, or whatsoever ye do, do all to the glory of God.
hmr: Chuongchun, in fâk khawmin, in dâwn khawmin, in thaw taphawta chun Pathien ropuina ding ruokin thaw ro.

en: Give no occasion of stumbling, either to Jews, or to Greeks, or to the church of God:
hmr: Judahai ta ding khawmin, Grik mihai ta ding khawmin, Pathien kohranhai ta ding khawmin an tlûk phâna ding hrim hrim iengkhawm thaw naw ro.

en: even as I also please all men in all things, not seeking mine own profit, but the profit of the many, that they may be saved.
hmr: Keiin mâni ta dinga ṭangkaina zawng loa sandam an ni theina dinga mi tamtak ta dinga ṭangkaina zawng lemin, mi po po iengkimah ka suk- lâwm ang tak hin.
